title: Rape case: Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s bail plea rejected, to remain in jail
content: Rahul Mamkootathil, who was arrested from Palakkad on January 11, is expected to approach the sessions court for bail. The application is scheduled to be filed on Monday

title: West Bengal has no ‘jaatiwad’: Manoranjan Byapari
content: Byapari’s books have always drawn from real rootless and marginalised people like him who make railway platforms and slums their home.

title: VB-G RAM G Act gamechanger for rural India: Arunachal deputy CM
content: “The Act, envisioned under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, legally assures 125 days of employment in rural areas and strengthens livelihood opportunities and village-level infrastructure,” says AP Deputy Chief Minister

title: CPI will play a vital role in Andhra politics after Khammam conclave: Kameswara Rao
content: State executive member Kameswara Rao said the CPI national body will give a clear road map for the strengthening of the party from grass root level in all the districts of Andhra Pradesh

title: NCP factions join hands for Maharashtra Zilla Parishad, Panchayat Samiti polls
content: Announcement has come in the wake of the severe drubbing the two NCP factions received in the Pune civic elections, where the BJP stunned the Pawars in their traditional stronghold, clinching 119 seats, with Ajit Pawar-led party coming in distant second with 27, and its ally NCP (SP) managing just three seats

title: Bheemanna Khandre: Life of a legend of Kalyana Karnataka in pictures
content: Bheemanna Khandre played an important role in the Karnataka Ekikarana (state unification) movement, especially in campaigns to ensure that Kannada-speaking districts of the erstwhile Hyderabad State, including Bidar, became part of Karnataka

title: Rahul meets patients, families of Indore water contamination victims
content: He visited four patients undergoing treatment at Bombay Hospital, a private facility, enquired about their health, and met their family members

title: Tribals hit streets to enforce Jharkhand bandh in protest against killing of village head
content: The State administration made elaborate security arrangements to maintain peace across districts, a senior police officer said, adding that additional forces have been deployed in the State’s capital Ranchi

title: No area of the Constitution should be immune from judicial review, says former CJI D.Y. Chandrachud
content: In a conversation with N. Ravi, the former Chief Justice says national security laws have turned the basic principles of bail on their head

title: Bheemanna Khandre: A life spanning freedom movement and contemporary politics in Karnataka
content: Khandre played an important role in the Karnataka Ekikarana (state unification) movement, especially in campaigns to ensure that Kannada-speaking districts of the erstwhile Hyderabad State, including Bidar, became part of Karnataka

title: ‘Blow to self-proclaimed Vishwaguru's self-boastful diplomacy’: Congress on U.S.-Pakistan military exercise
content: U.S. and Pakistani troops concluded a joint training at the National Counter-Terrorism Centre in Pabbi during the exercise, 'Inspired Gambit 2026'

title: Bollywood and Punjabi singer Praak gets ₹10 crore ransom threat, Dilnoor files police complaint
content: Dilnoor lodged a written complaint with SSP Mohali on January 6. Police have initiated an investigation into the matter

title: Bishop Franco Mulakkal sexual abuse case: Survivor-nun welcomes appointment of special public prosecutor
content: The nun, who chose to reveal her identity this time, said she was grateful that her request to government had been accepted. She thanked Kerala government, Chief Minister, and the general public for the support extended to her

title: Prohibitory orders imposed in Jalna over Dhangar agitation
content: District Collector Ashima Mittal issued an order under Section 163 in the BNSS, which deals with prohibitory orders for public safety, nuisance, or danger

title: Case filed over ‘fake’ Facebook posts claiming former Kerala MLA Shanimol Usman will quit Congress
content: Case registered based on a complaint by the Congress leader against pages named ‘Communist Kerala’ and ‘John Brittas Fans Group’ for allegedly spreading false and misleading content, say police

title: Four militants held for extortion activities in Manipur
content: “In separate operations, nearly 65 acres of illicit poppy cultivation were destroyed in parts of Kangpokpi and Churachandpur districts,” says police

title: Two Maoists killed in encounter between security forces and Maoists in Chhattisgarh
content: The gunfight erupted in the morning hours in the forested hills of the northwest region of the district

title: 4.1 magnitude earthquake hits Gujarat’s Kutch district; no casualties
content: The quake was recorded at 1:22 a.m. with its epicentre about 55 km north northeast (NNE) from Khavda in the district, says the Gandhinagar-based ISR

title: Guru Tegh Bahadur row: Delhi Speaker says forensic analysis found video not tampered with
content: The report clearly says that the alleged remark by Atishi was found matching frame by frame in the video clip, and it was original and there was no tampering involved, says Delhi Assembly Speaker Vijender Gupta

title: Forest Department captures elephant that killed woman in Hassan
content: Even after being hit by a tranquilizer, the elephant continued to move around for some time, forcing the staff to track its movement with drones

title: Alanganallur jallikattu begins on a high; gallery packed with tourists
content: The winner would walk home with a brand new car, while the runner-up would be given a two-wheeler. The third prize is an e-bike

title: Maharashtra civic polls: BJP clinches 1,425 seats across 29 municipal corporations
content: The BJP won 89, and ally Shiv Sena bagged 29 seats in the 227-member BMC, while Shiv Sena (UBT) managed 65 and MNS six seats

title: Russian man held for killing two female compatriots in north Goa
content: According to police official, Russian national Aleksei Leonov allegedly killed his friend Elena Vaneeva (37) in her room at Morjim on January 14 by slitting her neck with a knife

title: Samakka-Saralamma Jatara: The big tribal spiritual reset
content: As Telangana prepares for the biennial Sammakka-Saralamma Jatara, one of the world’s largest indigenous spiritual gatherings, the sacred heart of Medaram village has turned into a vast worksite. The redevelopment is designed to accommodate more devotees at the worship altar. Serish Nanisetti reports on a transformation unfolding at an unprecedented scale

title: How banking bottlenecks slow cybercrime investigations in Telangana
content: Fraudsters use every second, pushing funds through layers of mule accounts spread across multiple banks, while  investigators must track all transactions and alert each bank individually; this has to be done manually, unable to match the speed at which the funds disperse

title: 53-year-old arrested after acid attack on minor girl in Kerala’s Wayanad
content: According to police, the attack occurred on Friday evening. Police said there were ‘multiple issues’ between the neighbours that led to the incident

title: KGMU case: VHP protests in Lucknow over alleged religious conversions
content: The protesters urged the Special Task Force (STF), which is probing the case, to expedite the investigation and ensure stringent action against the guilty

title: SAD flags threat to Majithia's life inside jail, seeks Punjab Governor's intervention
content: The SAD appealed to Governor Gulab Chand Kataria to issue necessary directions to ensure the security of Majithia, a former Minister, saying it had no faith in the AAP government to take effective steps in this regard

title: Government aims to ‘formally recognise’ 1 lakh tribal healers from STs as ‘partners in health services’
content: At the plenary session, the Ministry of Tribal Affairs also signed MoU with the ICMR–Regional Medical Research Centre, Bhubaneswar, to set up India’s first National Tribal Health Observatory, to be known as the Bharat Tribal Health Observatory.

title: Dense fog blankets New Delhi; air quality index at 376
content: As cold wave conditions continued to prevail, dense fog enveloped large parts of Delhi leading to reduced visibility and delays in several flights at IGI airport

title: How slums are made and razed  in Bengaluru
content: Despite repeated promises of “housing for all” and affordable housing policies, Karnataka has consistently failed to ensure dignified housing for the poor in the growing city of Bengaluru, writes Rishita Khanna

title: AIMIM invites applications from candidates for upcoming municipal polls
content: Application forms are available for downloading from the party’s official Facebook page. They should be submitted, duly filled, along with a non-refundable demand draft of ₹3,000 drawn in favour of the party.

title: Students injured in bus accident near Kallambalam in Kerala capital
content: The students, from a private engineering college in Thrissur district, were reportedly on their way to the Vizhinjam port as part of a study tour. There were around 42 students in the bus.

title: Kashmir sees fresh snowfall in higher reaches; tourist rush triggers traffic snarls
content: This led to traffic jams as many visitors flocked to the resort to enjoy the snow. Numerous vehicles were stranded due to the ongoing snowfall, prompting assistance from police and CRPF personnel, officials added

title: CBI books former Punjab & Sind Bank branch heads in ₹1,621 crore mule account scam
content: The agency found that several individuals arranged forged and fabricated KYC documents, false rent agreements, and other fabricated supporting documents used for opening these accounts.

title: NIMHANS study proposes new model for early protein deposit formation in Parkinson’s disease
content: Researchers said such early changes could be better targets for future drugs, allowing intervention before irreversible nerve cell damage sets in

title: ‘Claim that 200 people were shot dead in Pollachi during anti-Hindi agitation is false’: Ex-Army officer debunks claims in Parasakthi
content: Madras Regiment was not a ‘Hindi army’ and comprised entirely of South Indians; machine guns were not used and around 10 civilians died, says ex-Army officer on claims made in Parasakthi

title: SIR in Uttar Pradesh | The first cut is the deepest
content: Uttar Pradesh has seen the largest number of voters deleted from the first draft of the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. Sreeparna Chakrabarty tracks down a few of the 2.89 crore left out of the list, some of whom migrated out of U.P. and some who have shifted houses within the State. Migrant workers from other States who had been registered in two locations must now choose one

title: CM Mamata inaugurates Mahakal temple in Siliguri
content: This is the third temple inaugurated by the Chief Minister; BJP says Mamata Banerjee is trying to influence Hindu voters

title: In Jharkhand, a tusker on a rampage
content: A male elephant, which has killed at least 20 people in the Chaibasa and Kolhan forest areas of West Singhbhum district, has become the symbol of the human-wildlife conflict in Jharkhand. A massive operation involving more than 100 forest personnel is under way to track the animal. Amit Bhelari reports on the attacks, which have led to panic in the villages, and the ongoing search

title: Call of inclusion and unity as RSS, Muslim leaders hold dialogue
content: Former Delhi Lieutenant Governor Najeeb Jung raises questions over denial of bail to activist Umar Khalid in 2020 Delhi riots case while RSS leader Ramlal refutes allegations of a particular section of society that the RSS only supports BJP

title: Overspending at Brahmapuram could lead to corruption: former Kochi Mayor Anilkumar
content: Former Mayor says people are aware of the transformation at the site since 2020 and questions claims that 2.5 lakh tonnes of waste remain to be bio-mined, arguing that scientifically landfilled waste need not be processed again

title: Shortcomings of Urban Health and Wellness Centres in Kochi flagged before NUHM
content: The alleged lack of commitment among doctors and the absence of critical facilities such as sample collection continue to affect the functioning of Urban Health and Wellness Centres

title: Narcotics cases on an upward spiral in Kerala
content: In Kochi, the number of cases under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act have shot up from 1,268 in 2020 to 6,914 in 2025. The pattern is similar in many other districts in the State. Enforcers are relentless in their hunt, but the peddlers mostly manage to outwit them with innovative means. G. Ragesh details how the outcome is proving detrimental to the young people in the State

title: Palaniswami’s refusal to commit himself to Old Pension Scheme shows that it is unfeasible
content: If voted back to power, his party will decide on going back to the old scheme “depending upon the situation”, the AIADMK leader has said, adding that his party will make only “feasible” promises

title: The Congress at 140, a crisis of structure
content: The challenge it faces amid right-wing political domination is of rebuilding party capacity without sacrificing its intrinsic pluralism

title: BMC poll results: BJP-Shiv Sena alliance ends Uddhav Thackeray’s hold over Mumbai
content: Though Uddhav Thackeray lost Mumbai for the first time, he won the Marathi vote bank and will be the prime opposition in the financial capital

title: Veteran Congress leader Bheemanna Khandre passes away at home in Bidar district
content: Bheemanna Khandre was a towering figure in the public life of Kalyana Karnataka and a senior leader of the Veerashaiva-Lingayat community

title: Scientists call for climate‑resilient model of irrigation and food production
content: The FPS underpinned by a 72% coal-based energy requirement has become one of India’s most carbon‑intensive public support mechanisms, necessitating a fundamental rethink of groundwater‑based irrigation and a broader shift in cropping and dietary patterns to reduce emissions and build resilience

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | Yakshagana ignites festival with myth, muscle, and magic
content: Kannada folk theatre finds new admirers among Malayali audiences as students bring epic battles and boundless energy to the fest stage

title: Special Intensive Revision claims phase to end on January 18; more than 12.8 lakh electors seek inclusion in rolls
content: Due to the exercise, nearly 97.37 lakh of the State’s 6.41 crore electors were deleted, reducing the size of the electorate to 5.43 crore

title: One tourist drowned, another missing after stepping on thin ice in Arunachal lake
content: The search for the missing person had to be suspended due to fading light and harsh weather; it will resume on Saturday at 8 a.m

title: Tamil Nadu Congress leaders to meet AICC in Delhi today to discuss demand for power-sharing in the State
content: TNCC leaders claim that the DMK is prepared to allot more seats to the Congress than the 25 given in 2021, but has ruled out sharing power

title: Maharashtra municipal elections verdict offers early cues for 2029 showdown
content: The results show the likely power dynamics within the Mahayuti, and also raise questions on the future of the Maha Vikas Aghadi as a collective Opposition front

title: Fadnavis hails ‘people’s trust’ as Mahayuti leads Maharashtra polls
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday hailed the “people’s trust” in the BJP–Shiv Sena Mahayuti after the alliance recorded a sweeping victory in Maharashtra’s civic body elections. The Mahayuti dominated polls across the State, including the high-profile Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, and is set to form mayors in 25 of the 29 municipal corporations. Fadnavis attributed the strong mandate to the alliance’s development-focused governance agenda.

title: Congress continuing in DMK alliance is doubtful: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: The National Democratic Alliance (NDA), headed by AIADMK, will jointly face the election with alliance parties, he says

title: Congress slams U.P. govt over Manikarnika Ghat redevelopment, alleges damage to Varanasi’s heritage
content: The redevelopment project has triggered protests against a demolition drive at the ghat, with demonstrators alleging damage to a century-old idol of Lokmata Ahilyabai Holkar

title: Balasore lynching: Three persons arrested
content: The Odisha police have identified eight others who were present at the spot when the man was attacked

title: Maharashtra civic poll results: BJP emerges as top party in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, AIMIM in second place
content: While the BJP won 57 out of the 93 seats it contested, the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena contested 96 seats but could win only 13 seats

title: An MGR film song that played often on Chief Minister Stalin’s car stereo
content: In Episode 2 of the #VibeWithMKS programme, he spent time with lyricists and musicians, listens to their performances, and answered their questions

title: A story of land, lives, and lores through the lens of a political activist
content: The exhibition at the College of Fine Arts in Thiruvananthapuram features photographs by Vijoo Krishnan, a Polit Bureau member of the CPI(M) and general secretary of the All India Kisan Sabha

title: ED seizes cash from premises of minor mineral mafias in Odisha
content: Premises searched belong to brokers, mafias, gangsters, local strongmen involved in illegal mining of sand, black stone, other minerals in Ganjam district, exploiting and terrorising residents, ED says

title: Diplomat’s meeting with Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami chief was routine: India
content: Ministry of External Affairs says interactions with political interlocutors in Dhaka are part of regular diplomatic engagement

title: Telangana Govt raises TDR offer to plot owners in water bodies
content: Plots falling within the FTL or MFL will be compensated with 200% of the built up space equivalent the area  surrendered, and lands falling within buffer area will get 300% of the same, according to the new policy

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | Kannur in the lead, but familiar rivals follow closely
content: With two days left and packed halls celebrating folk and classical forms alike, the race for the Gold Cup promises another nail-biting finish this year as well

title: Chennai-based body calls for improvement of amenities at the Ambedkar Memorial
content: People’s Educational Trust, which works for the welfare of the Scheduled Castes, has appealed to the DMK to include, in its 2026 election manifesto, the issue of better maintenance of the memorial

title: High stakes and bloodshed as rooster fights defy State ban across districts
content: Makeshift arenas in Krishna and Godavari districts drew large crowds for illegal betting during Sankranti, with punters winning up to ₹1.5 crore in single bouts despite strict government prohibition

title: 3 hideouts busted in J&K as part of anti-terror operation
content: The police had recovered two M4 empty cartridges, one plastic box containing desi ghee, one polythene packet containing almonds, hand gloves, one cap, one blanket, one tarpaulin sheet, one small pouch and a polythene bag

title: Clear ₹3900 crore dues, reinforce confidence among investors, alcobev makers urge government
content: Ahead of State’s participation in WEF in Davos later this month, it is important existing contractual commitments are honoured, three associations of the companies say

title: Pinarayi Vijayan attributes Kerala’s prevailing secular harmony to efforts of LDF govt. during last decade
content: Leader of Opposition  V.D. Satheesan criticises double standards in secular discourse, urges accountability for those spreading communal venom   Kerala Yatra organised by the Kerala Muslim Jamaat concludes in State capital

title: 1.03 crore new workers registered for ESIC after reforms: Labour Ministry
content: The scheme offers a one-time opportunity to register for ESI without concern for retrospective coverage or punitive action

title: Decoding Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad civic polls: Landslide win for BJP, combined NCPs no match
content: The BJP secured decisive victories in both Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad municipal corporations, exceeding their previous performance. This outcome dashed the hopes of the NCP alliance, led by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar, to reclaim their former strongholds. The results signal a significant setback for the NCP factions, prompting a need for strategic adjustments.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper flagged off: Howrah-Kamakhya train launched by PM Modi
content: Vande Bharat sleeper launch today: PM Narendra Modi flagged off Indian Railways' first Vande Bharat sleeper train set today. The new air-conditioned train will run between Howrah and Kamakhya, providing a premium and faster overnight travel option.

title: Iran unrest: Over 3,000 killed in nationwide protests; toll deadliest in decades
content: Nationwide protests in Iran have claimed over 3,000 lives, marking the deadliest unrest in decades. While authorities appear to have quelled demonstrations for now, internet connectivity remains severely restricted. The protests, initially sparked by economic woes, escalated into widespread challenges against the clerical leadership, drawing international attention and prompting a cautious response from the US.

title: R-Day alert: Intel flags terror threat from Bangladeshi, Khalistani outfits; Delhi among targets
content: Delhi and other major cities are on high alert for Republic Day due to intelligence warnings of potential attacks by Khalistani and Bangladesh-based terror groups.  These outfits are reportedly using Punjab-based gangsters as operatives, with increasing links to criminal networks across North India. Security forces are enhancing surveillance to counter these threats.

title: Jamie Dimon on future career: JPMorgan CEO rules out Fed Chair; open to Treasury post
content: In a bold declaration, JPMorgan's CEO Jamie Dimon firmly dismissed any aspirations to head the Federal Reserve, exclaiming 'no chance, no way, no how.' Nonetheless, he hinted at an intriguing possibility of stepping into the role of US Treasury Secretary. These remarks come on the heels of a public spat with President Trump about the autonomy of the Fed.

title: Four new Amrit Bharat Express! PM Modi to flag off trains - check routes & schedule
content: New Amrit Bharat Express trains: PM Narendra Modi will virtually inaugurate four new Amrit Bharat Express services, expanding affordable long-distance rail connectivity and strengthening mobility and economic linkages across multiple states.

title: Nvidia CEO advocates zero coding for engineers; this is what he wants them to do instead
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: From Gauri Lankesh murder accused to gangster kin: How Maharashtra voted for tainted corporators
content: Maharashtra civic polls saw controversial wins, including two relatives of jailed gangster Suryakant Andekar elected in Pune. In Jalna, Shrikant Pangarkar, an accused in journalist Gauri Lankesh's murder, secured a victory as an independent. These results have sparked significant public debate and criticism.

title: Russian man arrested for killing 2 Russian women
content: Goa police apprehended a Russian man, Alexei Leonov, after his live-in partner was found murdered in Arambol. Investigations revealed a second Russian woman, a mutual friend, was also a victim, with similar methods used in both killings. Witness accounts point to a violent altercation preceding the partner's death, leading to Leonov's escape and subsequent arrest.

title: ‘Happy Patel’ earns Rs 1.25 crore on opening day in theatres
content: In a thrilling mix of comedy and suspense, Vir Das' 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos' has officially kicked off its cinematic journey, earning an eye-catching Rs 1.25 crore on its first day in theaters.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn — now they’re clashing
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Relationship tip of the day: Sudha Murthy's marriage advice; 'If you have never fought'
content: Sudha Murthy, married for over 50 years, shared that marital fights are inevitable and part of the journey. She advises that when one partner is upset, the other should remain calm and listen, preventing escalation. This approach, she explained, helps navigate conflicts and strengthens the marriage.

title: Paradox of learning: How Indian higher education institutions produce unemployable graduates
content: Despite India producing millions of graduates each year, a growing number remain unemployable as higher education struggles to align with industry needs. With outdated curricula, minimal internships, and limited skill-based training, colleges are producing degrees that fail to translate into workplace readiness. The gap threatens youth livelihoods, employer productivity, and the nation’s economic potential.

title: Minnesota protest: US judge bars actions against protesters as tensions soar
content: A federal judge has prohibited immigration officers in Minnesota from detaining or using force against peaceful protesters amid rising tensions. The ruling restricts interactions, barring arrests without probable cause and the use of crowd-dispersal tools against protected speech. This injunction follows violent encounters and deaths during federal immigration operations.

title: A different Rohit Sharma: Why India's opener is batting more cautiously now
content: Rohit Sharma's aggressive batting approach, adopted after the 2022 T20 World Cup, has shifted to a more conservative style recently.  While his overall average remains strong, his strike rate has seen a dip.  Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate attributes this to challenging pitches and limited recent match practice, not a conscious change in strategy.

title: Arunachal Pradesh: Tourist dies as ice cracks on frozen Sela Lake, 1 missing
content: Tragedy struck Arunachal Pradesh's Sela Lake as a tourist lost their life and another remains missing after falling into the frozen waters. The incident occurred when ice cracked under the weight of tourists venturing onto the lake. Army rescuers braved extreme conditions to save two individuals, but one succumbed to injuries. Search efforts for the third person are ongoing.

title: ‘Dire consequences’: Bishnoi gang threatens Dilnoor; Rs 10cr demanded for B Praak
content: Punjabi singer Dilnoor reported a chilling threat to Mohali SSP after receiving a ransom demand of Rs 10 crore. The caller, identifying as Arju Bishnoi, instructed Dilnoor to tell B Praak to pay within a week or face severe repercussions. Police are actively investigating the foreign-originated calls and tracing the perpetrator.

title: BMC polls: Shinde Sena makes dent in UBT-MNS tally, but only just
content: Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena marked its presence in Mumbai's BMC elections by winning 29 seats, but the Thackeray clan's traditional grip on Marathi heartlands proved elusive. Although Shinde's party didn’t achieve as high a strike rate as the BJP, its role is crucial for sustaining the ruling alliance's strength.

title: Decoding BJP’s victory: How party outmaneuvered Thackeray ‘brand’ and Pawars in Maharashtra
content: BJP's latest electoral wins in Maharashtra mark a crucial phase in their strategy to disrupt the enduring political reign of the Thackeray and Pawar clans. By taking control of vital civic institutions and eroding their historical bastions, the party is set to transform the political terrain of the state, confronting years of established power and partisan allegiance.

title: Watch: White House press secretary loses cool over Minneapolis ICE shooting question
content: During a heated press briefing, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt confronted a journalist regarding a deadly ICE shooting, branding his inquiries as one-sided and accusing him of partisanship.

title: CBSE admit card 2026 released for private candidates: Check direct link to download hall tickets here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has released the CBSE Main Exam 2026 admit cards for Class 10 and 12 private candidates. The admit cards carry subject-wise mark details and passing criteria. Eligible categories include private, essential repeat, compartment, and improvement candidates. Students can download the hall tickets from the official CBSE website and must carry a printed copy to the exam centre.

title: Former Karnataka minister Bheemanna Khandre passes away at 102
content: Veteran freedom fighter and former Karnataka minister Bheemanna Khandre has passed away at 102. A prominent Congress leader and cooperative movement stalwart, Khandre served as Transport Minister and was instrumental in keeping Bidar district within Karnataka. His contributions to agriculture and education were significant. He is survived by his son, current Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre.

title: 'Dhurandhar' day 43: Film mints Rs 1275 crore worldwide
content: Despite facing new releases, the action-packed spy drama 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive run, entering its 76th week.  On its 43rd day, the film earned Rs 1.65 crore, outperforming new releases 'Happy Patel: Katarnak Jasoos' and 'Rahu Ketu', showcasing its enduring box office strength.

title: 'NCP’s strength revolves only around Ajit Pawar’: Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad election verdict a lesson
content: Despite challenging the BJP on his home turf, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's efforts in Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad civic elections failed to yield significant results. However, the alliance with Sharad Pawar's NCP (SP) has opened pathways for a united NCP, with Ajit Pawar gaining acceptance from his uncle's supporters for a potential merger.

title: ICE agent demands man’s documents 'because of his accent' in viral video
content: In a shocking viral clip, ICE agents are seen apprehending a man, with the leading officer attributing the detention to the man's 'accent.' Tensions rise quickly as the man challenges the agent's reasoning, resulting in a chaotic physical scuffle.

title: Pakistan batter runs himself out at U19 World Cup – Watch
content: England U19 secured a dramatic 37-run victory over Pakistan in their ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 opener. Despite a close contest, Pakistan's chase faltered, ending with a bizarre run-out of Ali Raza that sealed England's win.  England posted 210, with Caleb Falconer scoring 66, before bowling Pakistan out for 173.

title: Iran's exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi hails ties with India- what he said
content: Iran's exiled crown prince, Reza Pahlavi, highlighted the deep historical and cultural ties between India and Iran, envisioning a democratic future for his nation fostering close relationships with countries valuing sovereignty. He expressed optimism for future cooperation in technology and renewable energy, anticipating a new chapter for bilateral ties once Iran is free.

title: Babar Azam's angry BBL moment: Run denied, wicket lost, bat smashed - Watch
content: Babar Azam's rare on-field frustration during a BBL clash was overshadowed by Steve Smith's record-breaking century. Smith's explosive Power Surge and unbeaten 110 guided the Sixers to a thrilling five-wicket victory, eclipsing David Warner's earlier ton. Babar's dismissal and subsequent bat smash drew criticism, but Smith's historic knock stole the show.

title: 'No impact whatsoever': Mexico reacts to US FAA 'potential military activity' warning
content: Mexico's civil aviation remains unaffected by a US FAA safety advisory concerning potential military activity and GPS interference in parts of Central and South America. The Mexican government confirmed national airspace is fully operational with no restrictions for its airlines or operators. The FAA issued warnings for flights over Mexico and Central America due to "military activities."

title: How AIMIM defied internal turmoil to win 126 seats across Maharashtra
content: AIMIM achieved a significant electoral victory in Maharashtra's civic polls, winning 33 seats in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and 126 statewide. This success defied internal dissent and challenged perceptions of the party being solely for one community.  AIMIM's improved performance marks a notable jump from previous elections, demonstrating broader appeal.

title: BJP takes control of Mumbai for first time, but needs Shinde Sena for majority
content: In a stunning political shift, the BJP has taken control of Mumbai's Municipal Corporation (BMC), effectively ending the Thackeray family's nearly thirty-year dominance over the city's civic governance. The Mahayuti coalition, spearheaded by the BJP alongside Eknath Shinde's faction of the Shiv Sena, has surpassed the majority threshold, with the BJP poised to appoint the new mayor.

title: Why Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says engineers 'shouldn’t code at all': Here’s what he thinks matters more
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang advocates for engineers to eliminate coding from their daily tasks, focusing instead on problem discovery and solution design. He believes AI should handle the coding "task," freeing humans for the "purpose" of innovation, drawing parallels to how AI has reshaped radiology by augmenting, not replacing, human expertise.

title: 'Very poor' AQI: Thick smog engulfs Delhi; Stage-III GRAP restrictions return
content: Delhi grapples with severe smog as AQI hits 402, prompting Stage-III of GRAP. Restrictions on older vehicles and construction are now in effect to combat rising pollution. While the cold wave has ended, temperatures remain below normal, with dense fog also impacting visibility. Authorities are implementing a nine-point action plan to curb the deteriorating air quality.

title: Nipah virus has a high fatality rate: Doctor shares what makes the virus dangerous
content: Nipah virus, a deadly bat-borne illness, has resurfaced in West Bengal, raising concerns after past outbreaks in India.  Initial symptoms mimic common fevers, leading to delayed diagnosis.  With a high fatality rate and no cure, early detection and isolation are crucial.  Experts urge vigilance as the virus progresses rapidly, causing severe neurological issues.

title: Cooper Connolly: Inside the whirlwind rise of Australia’s all-rounder — exclusive
content: Cooper Connolly’s rise has been rapid. From a school classroom phone call notifying of a rookie contract to representing Australia in two U-19 World Cups, leading in one, to playing all three formats, bagging an IPL contract and now T20 World Cup selection, the 22-year-old reflects on family, reinvention, learning in India, batting versatility and the hunger that drives him.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Fadnavis, Thackerays & Pawars - top 10 winners & losers
content: Maharashtra's civic elections saw a significant political shift as the BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a dominant victory, particularly in Mumbai's BMC. Devendra Fadnavis and the BJP celebrated substantial gains, ending Shiv Sena's long-held control. Uddhav Thackeray's Sena and the Congress faced major setbacks, while Raj Thackeray's MNS and Sharad Pawar's NCP also saw diminished influence.

title: PM Modi To Witness 10,000 Bodo Dancers Perform Bagurumba During Assam Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will begin his two-day visit to poll-bound Assam today. On Saturday evening at around 6 pm, Prime Minister Modi will participate in a traditional Bodo cultural programme in Guwahati.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Mumbai Polls: How The 'Marathi Manoos' Campaign Ended Up Uniting Others Against It
content: Mumbai's demographic transformation over the past two decades has been dramatic. The city is now home to millions of migrants from across India, who felt directly threatened by the Thackerays' rhetoric.

title: Team Trump To Repeal Basis For US Climate Rules: What To Know
content: President Donald Trump's administration is finalising its repeal of a foundational scientific determination that underpins the US government's authority to regulate greenhouse gas emissions, with an announcement expected in the coming weeks.

title: Rahul Gandhi Meets Patients, Families Of Indore Water Contamination Victims
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday met patients and families affected by the vomiting and diarrhoea outbreak linked to water contamination in Madhya Pradesh's Indore city.

title: All About UN Biodiversity Treaty That Aims To Protect 30% Of Oceans By 2030
content: A landmark global treaty to safeguard biodiversity in the high seas came into effect on Saturday, providing countries with a legally binding framework to tackle threats such as overfishing.

title: In Pics: Kids Who Crashed Their Father's 2017 BBC Interview Are All Grown Up
content: The moment that made the family famous dates back to March 2017, when South Korea-based political analyst Kelly was speaking to BBC News.

title: "I Am Being Harassed": Indian Woman's Viral Audio After Pakistan Marriage
content: An emotional audio clip has gone viral on social media, purportedly featuring Sarabjeet Kaur, an Indian woman who travelled to Pakistan for a Sikh pilgrimage in November last year and later converted to Islam and married a Pakistani man.

title: Why Reza Pahlavi's Return To Iran's Throne May Not Be Great For India
content: Iran's exiled crown prince, Reza Pahlavi, who is aiming for a potential return to his erstwhile kingdom amid anti-government unrest, said a "democratic Iranian state" under him would seek close and cooperative relations with India.

title: Wife Of Key Accused In Nagpur Riots Wins Civic Election On AIMIM Ticket
content: The wife of the key accused in the 2025 Nagpur riots case has won civic polls on an AIMIM ticket from Nagpur. Alisha Khan (29) won from ward number 3 in Ashi Nagar zone of the Nagpur Municipal Corporation defeating Bhagyashree Kanatode of BJP.

title: After BMC Drubbing, Uddhav Sena's Balasaheb Post, Raj Thackeray's Open Letter
content: The Thackeray cousins have vowed to continue their Marathi identity politics after losing control of the country's richest civic body after 25 years.

title: BJP, Sena Win BMC Polls, Thackerays Lose Grip On Richest Civic Body
content: The BJP-led alliance has swept the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections, with the Thackerays losing grip on Mumbai's civic body after 25 years. The Mahayuti has come to power in 25 out of 29 civic bodies across Maharashtra.

title: Viral Video Shows Rajasthan Students Checking Answer Sheets, Prompts Action
content: In the clip, two people, a man and a woman, can be seen checking the answer sheets and mocking students.

title: Tylenol Pregnancy Study Contradicts Trump Claims On Autism Link
content: Using the common painkiller acetaminophen during pregnancy is not linked to neurodevelopmental disorders in children, according to a study published in the Lancet on Friday.

title: Assam Can Supply Electricity To Bangladesh, Says Tripura Chief Minister
content: At a time when anti-Bangladesh sentiment is brewing in India due to the recent attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh, Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha said the Assam government was keen to supply its surplus electricity to Bangladesh through Tripura.

title: "Beautiful Girl Can Distract A Man": Congress MLA's "Rape Theory" Sparks Row
content: Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya went on to say that women belonging to the SC, ST and OBC communities are not beautiful but still get raped because it is written in their scriptures.

title: Who Is Ajay Banga, Indian-Origin Banker Chosen By Trump For Gaza Peace Board
content: Ajay Banga is an Indian-American business executive with extensive experience across finance, banking and technology.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Great Nobel 'Giveaway': Machado About Nothing?
content: If the goal of politics is to get everything you want while giving up nothing, Trump has had a banner Venezuelan week.

title: Singer B Praak Gets Death Threat From Bishnoi Gang, Rs 10 Crore Demanded
content: Singer B Praak has reportedly received a death threat from a person claiming to be linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, with the caller allegedly demanding Rs 10 crore and warning of serious consequences if the demand is not met, officials said.

title: "No Internet, Dangerous Protests": First Flights From Iran Land In Delhi
content: The first two commercial flights carrying Indians from Iran landed in Delhi late last night, since violent protests erupted against the Khamenei regime.

title: BJP's 'Kashmir-Style Exodus' Jibe At Telangana Government Over Temple Attacks
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Dharmapuri Arvind on Friday launched a stinging attack on the Congress-led Telangana government over the recent attacks on Hindu temples in the state.

title: Everything you need to know for all four NFL divisional games: Score picks, predictions and storylines
content: Bills-Broncos. 49ers-Seahawks. Texans-Patriots. Rams-Bears. We have picks, stats to know, X factors and more for the divisional round.

title: How can four underdogs pull off upsets?
content: Could we see surprises? Let's find matchup advantages and X factors for the Bills, Bears, Texans and 49ers.

title: Chambliss files suit in state court seeking 6th year
content: Lawyers for Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss sued the NCAA in Mississippi court on Friday, seeking one more season of eligibility with the Rebels.

title: Mensah's candidates: Duke QB late add to portal
content: Duke starting quarterback Darian Mensah is entering the transfer portal. Mensah's decision comes less than a month after he chose to return to school instead of entering the NFL draft.

title: Utah transfer Moa follows Whittingham, picks U-M
content: Former Utah signee Salesi Moa, ESPN's No. 6 wide receiver in the 2026 class, will sign with Michigan, following new Wolverines head coach Kyle Whittingham.

title: OSU's Johnson granted TRO, can play immediately
content: Ohio State has added Penn State transfer Puff Johnson to its roster after he was granted a temporary restraining order for immediate eligibility on Friday morning.

title: Seahawks HC 'really optimistic' QB Darnold plays
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald said Friday that he's "really optimistic" Sam Darnold will play Saturday against the 49ers despite a new oblique injury.

title: Sources: Miami eyeing Berterame in $15M deal
content: Inter Miami is prepared to pay the $15 million release clause for Monterrey forward Germán Berterame, sources told ESPN.

title: EuroLeague unworried amid NBA's plans in Europe
content: EuroLeague CEO Paulius Motiejunas was critical of the NBA's proposed league on the continent, saying the plans have been "a little bit of a broken record of 'we will announce later.'"

title: Blues halt Lightning's run on Kyrou's shootout goal
content: Jordan Kyrou scored the only goal in a shootout, and the St. Louis Blues beat Tampa Bay 3-2 to snap the Lightning's franchise-record-tying 11-game win streak.

title: 🏈 2026 NFL draft: Field Yates' top 25 prospects
content: Who are the best players in this year's NFL draft class? Which receivers have first-round talent? Field Yates stacks his top 25 board.

title: How Mike Tomlin spent his final day as the Steelers head coach
content: 'It was dead silent' when the coach stunned the Steelers' locker room. Here's what we know about what's next.

content: Is the ACC back? Eight single-digit seeds -- including one on the top line -- and a couple of bubble teams would suggest so.

title: Women's: South Carolina ascends to No. 2 overall
content: Texas, which fell at South Carolina on Thursday, tumbles to the final No. 1 seed after its second straight loss.

title: Nobel medal has been sold before
content: Russian Journalist Dmitry Muratov (L) auctioned his Nobel prize for $103m to raise money for Ukrainianchild refugees; biologist James Watson sold his prize for over $4m Russian Journalist Dmitry Muratov (L) auctioned his Nobel prize for $103m to raise money for Ukrainianchild refugees; biologist James Watson sold his prize for over $4m Russian Journalist Dmitry Muratov (L) auctioned his Nobel prize for $103m to raise money for Ukrainianchild refugees; biologist James Watson sold his prize for over $4m

title: Beijing won its war for blue skies, but nearby villagers are paying the price
content: Across provinces near Beijing, govt has banned burning coal for residential heating to reduce pollution. At first, local govts eased the transition by heavily subsidising natural gas, which is cleaner but expensive. But this winter, officials cut the subsidies. Now, villagers are forced to sunbathe for warmth (NYT photo)

title: Power Rankings: How far Michigan, Iowa State, Vanderbilt drop after losses
content: the Wolverines and Cyclones have a long list of blowout victories . they own a 23-point road rout at Purdue . a shuffle in ESPN's Power Rankings has prompted a massive drop .

title: Power Rankings: SEC shaping national title race
content: the day-to-day challenges of January are key in putting that picture together . the AP-ranked SEC currently has nine teams battling each other for supremacy . they have already met this season in a game that didn't count in the standings .

title: Ranking the top 25 women's players midway through 2025-26
content: Sarah Strong topped ESPN's preseason ranking of the 25 best players in women's college basketball for 2025-26 . she hasn't budged since, but the rest of the list has changed a lot . the SEC is the top conference with 13 players appearing on the midseason list .

title: Rams-Bears set to join list of coldest playoff games
content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: Kompany's Bayern Munich chasing history, as Reyna looks to improve
content: Vincent Kompany beat Köln 3-1 to equalise pep Guardiola's Bundesliga record . he was keen to swat aside comparisons between himself and his boss . Bayern now have 66 goals and are almost certain to smash 101 goals across a single campaign .
